metadata.title: IELTS Vocabulary with Russian Translations
metadata.description: Comprehensive IELTS vocabulary categorized by CEFR levels (A1-C2) with Russian translations

vocabulary.definition: To inspect or investigate something in detail
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The committee will examine the proposal in detail.

vocabulary.definition: To examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of something
vocabulary.exampleSentence: We need to analyze the data before drawing conclusions.

vocabulary.definition: Sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; noteworthy
vocabulary.exampleSentence: There has been a significant improvement in her performance.

vocabulary.definition: To form an idea of the amount, number, or value of; assess
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The study evaluates the impact of climate change on agriculture.

vocabulary.definition: A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation
vocabulary.exampleSentence: Several hypotheses have been proposed to explain this phenomenon.

vocabulary.definition: To successfully bring about or reach a desired objective or result by effort, skill, or courage
vocabulary.exampleSentence: She worked hard to achieve her goals.

vocabulary.definition: A way of dealing with a situation or problem; a manner of considering or handling something
vocabulary.exampleSentence: We need to adopt a different approach to solve this problem.

vocabulary.definition: An abstract idea; a general notion or idea
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The concept of sustainability is crucial for modern businesses.

vocabulary.definition: To set up or create an organization, system, or set of rules on a firm or permanent basis
vocabulary.exampleSentence: The government established new regulations for environmental protection.

vocabulary.definition: Forming the foundation or base; central or essential
vocabulary.exampleSentence: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right in democratic societies.

schema.description: Data structure for IELTS vocabulary entries compatible with LexiconFlow DataImporter

cefrLevel.description: CEFR level according to Cambridge English Vocabulary Profile

exampleSentence.description: Example sentence showing usage in IELTS context

notes: This JSON structure extends the FlashcardData model with IELTS-specific fields
CEFR level and Russian translation are required for IELTS vocabulary
Phonetic is optional but recommended for pronunciation learning
Part of speech helps with grammatical understanding

usage.importInstruction: Use DataImporter service to import this vocabulary into SwiftData
usage.deckCreation: Can create separate decks by CEFR level or combined IELTS deck
usage.filtering: UI will support filtering by CEFR level in deck view
usage.badges: CEFR badges will display in card detail and study views

references.notes: CEFR levels based on Cambridge English Vocabulary Profile - authoritative source for vocabulary classification
